pullrequest.title: Fix issue 2111 by providing options to preserve world velocity when set positions

content.raw:
This is also why I removed the line that tests the parent's velocity. The velocity-zeroing effect of `SetPosition(~)` only affects the child's velocity and the relative velocity between them.

Logically, this should imply that the parent's velocity will also be zeroed, except the effect of the zeroing won't get transferred upstream until the next time step. However, when that transfer does happen, it effectively averages out their velocities because of conservation of momentum.
content.html:
This is also why I removed the line that tests the parent's velocity. The velocity-zeroing effect of SetPosition(~) only affects the child's velocity and the relative velocity between them.

Logically, this should imply that the parent's velocity will also be zeroed, except the effect of the zeroing won't get transferred upstream until the next time step. However, when that transfer does happen, it effectively averages out their velocities because of conservation of momentum.
